entry.title: Fix same-version overinstalls on Mac.
entry.content:
OverinstallBroken exercises this codepath. It fails without this patch, which is intended to fix the issues revealed by this test:



* CopyDir fails if the bundle already exists. Removing the version directory first avoids this (and cleans up any other unexpected state in the destination).

* Failed update service proxy objects did not totally reset state on failure -- it could think it was still trying to connect after the connection attempt failed. Tracking connection-ness state separately from bound-ness of the mojo::Remote is unnecessary; removing tracking the "connecting" state gets rid of the unintended state reached here.

* After trying to change which update service exists and is active, it's a bit weird to expect the (previously failed) UpdateServiceProxy to keep working as intended. It does, but it feels conceptually weird. After a WakeCandidate, rebuild update_service_ to clean this up.



Also cleans up an IWYU violation on scoped_refptr.h



Bug: 1456556

entry.title: Update host window bounds when scale factor has changed
entry.content:
With crrev.com/c/4630949 and crrev.com/c/4639542, the content size

of a root surface is used to check if the host window bounds

should be updated or not.



However, when there's a maximized window and scale factor changes,

only DP size changes while PX size stays the same. In this case,

host_window_->SetBounds() isn't called, and leads to a size

mismatch between the widget and host window.



Bug: b/290862328

entry.title: Fix gn build dependency encapsulation for //skia and //net
entry.content:
Deep in the dependency tree, //skia and //net/third_party/quiche define

build configs which are necessary for compiling headers from those

libraries. These are exported through public_configs. This means that

any file which transitively #includes anything from these directories

must have a dependency on //net and/or //skia, whether directly through

deps, or indirectly through public_deps, in order for the file to

compile.



This breaks encapsulation further up the dependency tree. For example,

//c/b/apps/app_service indirectly #includes files from these targets,

but does not export them as public_deps. Targets depending on

app_service won't compile unless they happen to have some other dep on

//net and //skia. The dependency is deeply nested and so there's no

obvious reason why this dep would be needed. Since most targets in Chromium are very large, this isn't normally a noticeable problem,

but it has caused problems in //c/b/chromeos/office_web_app.



gn has an option for this, `all_dependent_configs`, which applies the

config to everything which transitively depends on the target. This CL

applies that option to the existing configs defined for //skia and

//net/third_party/quiche.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Ia33822cd12d957a1dafcd1a9f67c08fd7965cbfc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4665362

Reviewed-by: Brian Osman

Commit-Queue: Tim Sergeant

Reviewed-by: Alexander Bolodurin

Reviewed-by: Adam Rice

Reviewed-by: Stephen White

entry.title: iwa: Migrate Storage Partitions GC from Extensions to Web Apps system
entry.content:
Both Chrome Apps and Isolated Web Apps use isolated Storage Partitions.

This means any Storage Partition garbage collection system using

BrowserContext::GarbageCollectStoragePartitions() must be aware of valid

Storage Partition paths from both systems.



Chrome Apps are being deprecated and IWAs need to work with web app

command system to avoid race conditions. We are migrating Storage

Partition garbage collection system from ExtensionsGarbageCollector to

web_app::GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand. The new GC system will

support Chrome Apps until they are fully removed.



This CL does a few things to fully delete

ExtensionGarbageCollector::GarbageCollectIsolatedStorageIfNeeded and

replace it with GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand.



For Extensions code:

- Replace ExtensionsPref::kStorageGarbageCollect with

pref::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions

- Remove

ExtensionGarbageCollector::GarbageCollectIsolatedStorageIfNeeded and

its associated InstallGate.



For Web Apps code:

- Register pref::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions.

- Sets prefs::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions to true in

remove_web_app_job.cc

- Register and unregister extensions::InstallGate in

GarbageCollectStoragePartitionsCommand via ExtensionsManager.

- Invokes GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand in PostProfileInit if

pref is true.

- Implicitly call GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand from restart

using PRE test in

garbage_collect_storage_partitions_command_browsertest.cc



Low-Coverage-Reason:



Change-Id: I5d418dc1b1f7bfc5890850d94d11a827b794b2ff

Bug: 1453520

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4663920

Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

Reviewed-by: Robbie McElrath

Commit-Queue: Zelin Liu

Reviewed-by: Daniel Murphy

entry.title: CrOS GMC V2: Enable the start casting button on the quick settings media
entry.content:
view



Clicking the start casting button on the quick settings media view

should redirect the user to the quick settings media detailed view and

open the device selector view there instead.



This is achieved by adding

MediaNotificationContainer::OnShowCastingDevicesRequested() and

MediaItemUIObserver::OnMediaItemUIShowDevices() to pass the

show_devices_for_item_id to UnifiedSystemTrayController,

UnifiedMediaControlsDetailedViewController, MediaNotificationProvider,

BuildDeviceSelectorView() in media_item_ui_helper, and eventually

MediaItemUIDeviceSelectorView to show the devices by default.

entry.title: Add a new scale factor request to remote_shell_v2
entry.content:
Partly analogous to Lacros change: crrev.com/c/4034899.



This CL adds a new Wayland protocol to remote_shell_v2 to give

clients control to synchronize buffers and scale factors.



The new protocol exactly matches the counterpart in

aura_toplevel so we can share the implementation as much as

possible and prevent potential rounding errors.



The actual change in ClientControlledShellSurface will be made

once all clients of remote_shell_v2 supports this protocol as

there's no way for ClientControlledShellSurface to know if it's

supported or not (b/c ShellSurfaceHost::GetScaleFactor just

returns float instead of optional).



Bug: b/290565343

entry.title: Revert "Fix race condition and re-enable tests."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9a19121ba164716769ebb468350fa57ef28b44cc.



Reason for revert: Using WebContentsObserver brought back an old crash bug, which I now recall is why we were using the render widget host. This CL needs to be reverted.



See the failure here:

https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8775645265322080401/test-results?q=HelpBubbleFactoryWebUIInteractiveUiTest.FloatingHelpBubbleHiddenOnWebUiHidden&sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Fix race condition and re-enable tests.

>

> Failures were caused by a race condition in HelpBubbleHandler that could affect Aura platforms. This update fixes the race condition, which caused the affected tests to flake, by switching to observing WebContents visibility rather than RenderWidgetHost.

entry.title: [Nearby][Self Share] Advertise when in YourDevices visibility
entry.content:
Enable YourDevices visibility certificates to be created and uploaded

to the Nearby server.



Note that, at the moment, when creating a public certificate for

upload, setting the `for_self_share` field doesn't allow for a

functional 'Your Devices' visibility (b/291132662).

To circumvent this problem, when in Your Devices visibility,

in this CL, the public certificate is set to 'Selected Contacts',

which is effectively 'Your Devices' visibility because the allowed

contacts list is empty besides the user's own account.

This hack should be fixed in the future but is working for now.



Tested: no issues when deployed to DUT



Fixed: b/279939804

entry.title: WebUI: Migrate access_code_cast tests to WebUIMochaBrowserTest.
entry.content:
WebUIMochaBrowserTest is the new way of running WebUI tests without any

dependency to the obsolete js2gtest and test_api.js mechanism.



Also doing minor renaming of tests, now that previous js2gtest

constraint of having a dedicated C++ class for each test case does not

exist and removing the somewhat meaningless '*.All' naming pattern,

which also makes running such tests much easier by specifying

--gtest_filter=AccessCodeCastTest.* instead of

--gtest_filter=AccessCodeCast*Test.All

entry.title: [Tab Previews] Only capture preview on actual tab switch.
entry.content:
Tab Previews wants to capture any tab that is being switched away from;

this saves any visual updates (such as scrolling) that happened while

the tab was visible to the user.



However, previously, this was done by watching the WebContents for

visibility changes, which also caught a number of potentially unwanted

or even unsafe situations, such as:

- A closing tab

- A tab in a browser window being closed

- A tab being moved between browser windows (but still active)



This CL does two things:

- Changes this capture to happen only on active tab switch.

- Checks RenderWidgetHostView::IsSurfaceAvailableForCopy(), which may

further avoid issues on e.g. Mac (and is generally considered best

practice).



It also cleans up some small code issues.



Bug: 1374153

entry.title: Hook up webview to gpu OnVisibilityChanged
entry.content:
A webview is visible if it's attached a window and window is visible.

Note this is simpler than "client visibility" which defaults to true

even when starting as detached. And gpu is background if all webviews

are not visible.



Need some complexity between BrowserViewRenderer and

SynchronousCompositor since a single BVR can talk to be multiple

SynchronousCompositors. Only mark the active one visible, but ensure

to always keep at least one SynchronousCompositor visible during

transition.



Then net effect is will immediately call

GpuChannelManager::OnApplicationBackgrounded on background.

On low end devices, will also run

GpuChannelManager::OnBackgroundCleanup with a delay, which (tries to)

cleans up the GPU thread context and drops GPU channels.



Bug: 1442988

entry.title: [Inspector] Skip adding source data for non-existent implicit nested groups
entry.content:
See the bug for the reproduction and issue description.



The crux of the issue lies in nested group rules[1] and how the parser notifies the observer when they encounter such rules.



Take the CSS below as example:

```

.foo {

@supports(display: flex) {

& {

color: red;

}

}

}

```



While parsing the body of the `@supports` rule above, CSS parser notifies the observer that this might be the start of the implicit nested group with a zero length header range[2].



However, if there are no properties for this implicit nested group, CSS parser doesn't register it so such a group doesn't exist for the rule list got from the parser[3].



in this CL, to match the same behavior with the CSS parser while registering the source data, we check whether there are any properties parsed for this possible "implicit nested group".



If not, we skip adding the rule itself and only take its child rules' data.



[1]: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-nesting-1/#nested-group-rules

[2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_impl.cc;l=2122;drc=255b4e7036f1326f2219bd547d3d6dcf76064870

[3]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_impl.cc;l=2131;drc=255b4e7036f1326f2219bd547d3d6dcf76064870



Fixed: 1445720

Change-Id: Ifbd2e85873374929d0ceadf4fb5905eaf4ddd62b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4681759

Reviewed-by: Changhao Han

Commit-Queue: Changhao Han

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1170208}

entry.title: Consolidate classroom course work related structs
entry.content:
Removes GlanceablesClassroomStudentSubmission, which is used only to

cache student submissions when requesting classroom data, and then to

calculate the course work "submission" status. The submission state is

now add directly to GlanceablesClassroomCourseWorkItem, and is updated

dynamically in response to fetching student submissions. When fetching

course work and student submissions data, GlanceablesClassroomClientImpl

will keep the fetched data in the `course_work_` map, and update it as

responses come in. Note that GlanceablesClassroomCourseWorkItem

intentionally has only default constructor, to support the case where

student submissions for a course work item are fetched before the actual

course work item (which could be the case when fetching assignments for

students). Also, moves GlanceablesClassroomCourseWorkItem class to

chrome/, as it's not used in ash/, and so it can take dependencies on

raw classroom google api types.



BUG=b:283371186

entry.title: Use UI message loop type for Linux Print Backend service
entry.content:
Printing a document on Linux makes calls through the

PrintDialogLinuxInterface. Calls made through this interface can

appear to succeed but actually fail to run if there is not a running

message pump to process the commands issued. This causes a false

positive for printing status, with no errors reported but also no print

job actually printing.



Update the invocation of Linux to use a UI message loop type. Also

change the thread runner used on Linux to work with the default runner.

This ensures that the printing commands actually run.



Fixed: 1464683

Change-Id: I69d27739bef732bd52e12473d6ea7ff7deef039a

entry.title: Update compositing on scroll if a synthethized clip depends on scroll
entry.content:
A synthesized clip layer that masks a layer with backdrop effect bakes

the difference between the clip's transform space and the masked

layer's transform space in the layer geometry and paint operations.

If the transform spaces cross any scroll translation, we can't omit

PAC update on any scroll of the scroller.



Bug: 1459318

entry.title: [PhoneHub][Nudge]Update nudge and notification display logic and add
entry.content:
experiment control logic.



For the Phone Hub nudge experiment, the multi-device notification and

phone hub icon/nudge should be shown:

a) immediately post OOBE setup if eligibility is available;

b) within 5 minutes of user session if eligibility is available or;

c) at the next login if eligibility is found after 5 minutes into user

session.



Bug: b/282990933

Tested: Manually tested and verified following cases on DUT:

1). When feature flag disabled: notification behaviors stay unchanged.

2). When in nudge experiment group: a). PH icon and nudge appear after

OOBE completed; b) PH icon and nudge appear if user becomes

eligible for PH within 5 minutes of session start; c), PH icon and

nudge do not appear until next login/unlock if user becomes

eligible after 5 minutes of session start.

3). When in notification experiment group, notification and PH icon

behave the same as in 2).



Change-Id: I92c46da8e0a11181e32da9d9c72df2bcc1e02168

entry.title: Reland "[user bypass] Add bubble unit tests"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 05cb7a929cd403afe368a8f17287103d67c6ceae with the fix in commit 45d20368cfd3e80a0902414ade905186f88ed112. These were erroneously reverted by the gardener (me).



Original change's description:

> [user bypass] Add bubble unit tests

>

> Add unit tests for coordinator and view controller. Split bubble view

> into CookieControlsBubbleView and CookieControlsBubbleViewImpl to have

entry.title: [QuickStart] Return More Granular Errors from QuickStartMessage::Read
entry.content:
This change makes `QuickStartMessage::Read` return a more granular error

on parsing. This is important, since for the FIDO flow, we want to skip

over messages which aren't FIDO messages. This change allows us to

distinguish between different messages entirely (different Payload

keys), and messages which failed serialization for other reasons.



Test: Updated Unit Tests

entry.title: Fix folder upload triggering two detection requests.
entry.content:
1. Merge the logic of `FolderUploadContentAnalysisCompletionCallback` into `ContentAnalysisCompletionCallback`.

2. Update the relevant test cases, delete the `FolderUploadBlockedThenAllowed` one since it is no longer applicable.

3. Replace some `FULL_SAFE_BROWSING` build flag with `ENTERPRISE_CLOUD_CONTENT_ANALYSIS` to better reflect when the code should be run.

4. Include `net/cert/x509_certificate.h` in `chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_window.cc` because previously it was implicitly included via `chrome/browser/file_select_helper.h`

5. Manual testing screencast (https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjAxNTQ4MTUzMTA3MjUxMnxlMTgwOTRkYy01OQ)

* Upload a folder with sensitive file would trigger only 1 detection request, the entire folder is blocked

* Upload a folder with non-sensitive file only would go through

so that the sheet is not dismissed when the user hides a tab. This means

that there may be multiple pending bottomsheets at a given time, so the

BottomSheetObserver needs to only care about changes when the latest

bottomsheet is the one owned by the object, so onSheetContentChanged()

is used for this purpose. A TabObserver is used to ensure that the

bottomsheet is only shown when the tab is interactable.



Bug: 1456368

entry.title: Don't remove focus from page elements during content scanning.
entry.content:
If focus is removed, then when the user pastes into an edit field, then

after the paste is done, they will need to click the field again to

continue typing. Instead of clearing focus when a content analysis

dialog is showed, save it. Then restore the focus when the dialog

is destroyed.

entry.title: Audio: Create histogram for recording mic gain change
entry.content:
- This new metric records when a user changes the input gain and they

don't set to force respecting UI gains.



Through this metric, we want to see that the number of times the input

gain being changed in ignoring UI gains group is no more than the one

without ignoring.

If a user sets to force respecting UI gains by toggling the force

respect UI gains setting, they will be excluded in the experiment.



Experiments design: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nISIRtle-elQMuBQHwO002xgwqtR3mdk1TJdmZZHbAM/edit?resourcekey=0-_aYvkoae_W9US7k7Y7GzTw#

entry.title: webcodecs: More deterministic rate control for VT VEA
entry.content:
(AKA drop a lot of code that makes things worse)



1. Use artificial frame timestamps in VT VEA, to make sure that rate

control is guided by the framerate.

2. Remove webrtc::BitrateAdjuster that uses current time as an input

instead of the frame timestamp.

3. Stop using kVTCompressionPropertyKey_DataRateLimits because

it's not compatible with low latency and makes the encoder

undershoot.



Bug: 1450500, 1444151

entry.title: ts_library: Allow the use of isolatedModules TS compiler flag.
entry.content:
Google style guide for TypeScript has recently been changed to allow

"import type {...}" and "export type {...}". The isolatedModules flag

tells TypeScript compiler to impose additional checks which forbids code

that doesn't work well with single file transpilers, without any other

changes how the code is checked or emitted.



This allows individual ts_library user to opt-in to the stricter check

if they want their code base to work with transpilers outside of the

Chrome build process.



Bug: b:231413193

Test: build chrome

entry.content:
This new flag is used by data collector in Uprev test stage to allow

generation of dev caches for installation by arccachesetup service

during boot and allow ureadahead to run akin to production environment

where other arc caches are already pre-installed. This in turn optimizes

ureadahead tracing to not double cache redundant data into pagecache

that is already installed by other ARC caches.

entry.title: Add traits to background task for periodic ongoing logs
entry.content:
Explicitly add CONTINUE_ON_SHUTDOWN as a trait since there is no

point in blocking shutdown since the reply task won't be run, and the

work done on the background thread will have been done for nothing.



Currently, the task uses default trait, which has a high priority

(USER_BLOCKING). Explicitly add that as well.

entry.title: [Extensions] Align response ack behavior in Page Capture API
entry.content:
The Page Capture API requires an ack from the renderer when it receives

the response from the API function call so that the browser knows when

to release a reference to a shared file. This is currently handled in

two ways:

* For non-service worker calls, the ExtensionFunction itself listens

to messages from the renderer and handles the call. As part of this,

it needs to poke into the IPC message data and extract out the UUID

before determining if it needs to handle the message, since the

messages are just routed to the web contents.

* For service worker calls, the ExtensionFunction registers itself

with the ExtensionFunctionDispatcher, which receives the notice of an

ack.



Instead, align all response acks on the service worker approach. This is

less code, eliminates the ugly handling of poking into the IPC message

data, and will make other improvements (such as better lifetime) easier

to address.



Bug: 1463777

Change-Id: I6f54509404ec430886bba9d180aabbbfadfcaaf6

entry.title: Store a scoped_refptr instead of raw_ptr
entry.content:
CookieSettingsFactory::GetForProfile returns a scoped_refptr. If

`.get()` is called on that scoped_refptr immediately, then

~scoped_refptr is called as the pointer goes out of scope, which may

result in the pointee being freed. Therefore, it is better to store

the scoped_refptr directly, so that the pointee won't get accidentally

freed while we hold a pointer to it.



Change-Id: I680880f7fb99e4e3316f08ae05f2c332af20bbe8

entry.title: multipaste: Show Ctrl+V label under the contents of the first menu item
entry.content:
This CL adds a label underneath the clipboard history menu's first item.

The label shows the text "Ctrl+V", indicating that the first item

corresponds to the content in the user's clipboard and would be pasted

if the user had just pressed Ctrl+V rather than opening the clipboard

history menu.



Currently, pressing Ctrl+V while the clipboard history menu is open does

nothing. This could be confusing with the addition of this CL's label,

so a subsequent CL will allow users to paste using Ctrl+V while the

clipboard history menu is open.



Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5ZNDNhfz5y6cMHA

entry.title: media: Implement hardware secure decryption per site fallback
entry.content:
Add a feature to fallback from hardware secure decryption to software

secure decryption per site.



This feature uses PrefService to track hardware secure decryption

failures per site and disable hardware secure decryption for a site when

too many failures/crashes occur.



Full design for this feature is described in

go/hardware-secure-per-site-fallback.



This feature is manually tested according to the test plan in

go/hardware-secure-per-site-fallback.

entry.title: Fix overscroll delta calculation
entry.content:
InputHandler::ScrollUpdate was only counting overscroll deltas where

content did not move at all. This omitted deltas in cases

where content moved but not all of the input delta was consumed.



This is the cause of the flakiness for some WPTs so this patch updates

TestExpectations and removes an obsolete expected.txt file.

entry.content:
This reverts commit 8525e454b007e742d1817b03fbe824a5f30d7aab.



Reason for revert: The revert is caused by Kevin build failed.

The latest image built for Kevin is on 15511 while the dependent change(crrev/c/4206140) is landed on 15514.



Kevin is EOL in M116 and is replaced by jacuzzi for LKGM CL.(More context: b/290268385)



Original change's description:

> Revert "[VoiceIsolation] Add new stream effect VoiceIsolation."

>

> This reverts commit 6eac3ae3f0b40f0fdcc292b77549405dbfbfb402.

>

> Reason for revert: build break: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/chromeos-kevin-chrome/27478/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > [VoiceIsolation] Add new stream effect VoiceIsolation.

> >

> > New api introduced to provide the options to force turn on/off system

> > voice isolation(NC) effect and check the platform availability.

> >

> > The control will be a tri-state composed of two bits(browser_controlled_{effect}, {effect}).

> > !browser_controlled_{effect}: leave as platform default.

> > browser_controlled_{effect} && {effect}: force enable platform {effect}

> > browser_controlled_{effect} && !{effect}: force disable platform {effect}

> >

> > Design: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1a1zy_wYTgKhaPIAZ53lR8Y1RQzuzhND_kV7PLlP5WzE/edit?resourcekey=0-snrCqjLZrU8Bt9V0kW2hZA#heading=h.c0uts5ftkk58

entry.title: WebUI: Migrate c/b/r/tab_search tests to WebUIMochaBrowserTest.
entry.content:
WebUIMochaBrowserTest is the new way of running WebUI tests without any

dependency to the obsolete js2gtest and test_api.js mechanism.



Also doing minor renaming of tests, now that previous js2gtest

constraint of having a dedicated C++ class for each test case does not

exist and and removing the somewhat meaningless '*.All' naming pattern.

Example renames:

- TabSearchAppTest.All -> TabSearchTest.App

- TabSearchBiMapTest.All -> TabSearchTest.BiMap



which also makes running such tests easier by specifying

--gtest_filter=TabSearchTest.* instead of

--gtest_filter=TabSearch*Test.All

entry.title: [Ash] Use the Prefs service to observe extension-set proxies
entry.content:
Currently extension-set proxies are intercepted by the

LacrosExtensionProxyTracker which sends the proxy config along with the

extension metadata to Ash using the NetworkSettingsService mojo service.

The NetworkSettingsService stores the new proxy config using the kProxy

pref, in the user store.



This CL changes the the NetworkSettingsService implementation in Ash

to (indirectly) use the Prefs mojo service to get the proxy config set

by the Lacros primary profile and modifies the

LacrosExtensionProxyTracker to only set and clear extension metadata.



This CL also removes all the logic which monitors proxy updates

outside of NetworkSettingsServiceAsh.



Bug: 1411949, b/267135604, b/192453302

entry.title: Android: Migrate Leave Incognito mode from alert dialog to Modal dialog
entry.content:
This CL migrates the usage of AlertDialog to Modal dialog for

ExternalNavigationHandler which solely used it for the

"Leave Incognito mode?" confirmation dialog.



The use of AlertDialog had limitations which resulted in issue stated

in crbug.com/1462104, around click-jacking. The click-jacking issue

has been solved elsewhere for permission dialogs (which are powered

by Chrome's modal dialog framework) by introducing some

delay when the buttons in the dialog becomes functional.



Following the same, this CL upgrades the AlertDialog to use Chrome's

Modal dialog support instead.



Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dkOr2hQodrjS4Ogy7qjiQZPWfAXGtqcN/view?usp=sharing

Bug: 1462104, 1422272, b/291039251

entry.title: media: Fix CdmService process name
entry.content:
In https://crrev.com/c/2957089, we changed the service hosted by the

CdmService process from CdmService to CdmServiceBroker. But we missed

some files, and the service process name is not displayed correctly,

e.g. in about://tracing traces.



This CL fixes this issue.



Also does the same for the new MediaFoundationService process.



Tested by grabbing a trace and verified the display name. See:

- https://photos.app.goo.gl/rNntfoY46J1gfo876

- https://photos.app.goo.gl/95T5PdLTBPr2Q6A48



Companion CL: https://android-review.git.corp.google.com/c/platform/external/perfetto/+/2654170
